results.title: Labor and childbirth
results.creator_credit: D.M. Hatfield and Photo & Sound Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A young couple expects their first child. Shows onset of labor, the trip to the hospital, call to doctor, admission to maternity ward, routine preparations for delivery, including instructions to mother, and normal birth of child. Stresses the assumption that fear stems from lack of knowledge.

results.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
First in a series of four films on the history and wildlife of Macquarie Island, 1,700 km South of Australia. The film shows man’s massive slaughter of the island’s seals and penguins for oil; the return after elimination 150 years ago of the New Zealand fur seal; stills and historical footage of the rape of the island’s resources, and a look at how the wildlife there is now being studied by the Antarctic division of the Australian Department of Science. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES

results.title: The Year of the Kings
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
The final program in this series traces a full year’s life cycle of the King Penguin. These birds have had to adapt to a harsh environment on Macquarie Island, and have developed a well-organised social structure.

group_siblings.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC

results.title: The Dominant male
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
One of four films about Macquarie Island. In September giant elephant seals come to mate and pup. This program follows events at the largest harem on the island, with 1,500 cows and 50 males. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary, production and photography by David Parer.

results.title: Ocean Wanderers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
Second in a series on the wildlife of Macquarie Island. The film shows the life cycles of the Wandering Albatross, the Rockhopper Penguin, the Black Browed Albatross and the Grey Headed Albatross

results.title: International Monetary System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
An historically detailed understanding of the international monetary system. Covers the Bretton Woods system with its features; role of the US dollar, International Monetary Fund, performance, problems and final collapse. Follows on after Bretton Woods system with the managed float era, pressure and problems, issues and possible reforms to the international monetary system.

group_siblings.title: The Role of government in the Australian economy

results.title: Stock exchange & takeovers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
(HSC economic series) A comprehensive introduction to the stock exchange and takeovers. Covers the reason for having a stock exchange and how it works; buying and selling; how the public is informed; defines takeovers and their motivation; explains how are they made and if they are good or bad for the economy. No other credits available.

group_siblings.title: The Role of government in the Australian economy

results.title: The Role of government in the Australian economy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck examines the role of the Australian Government in formulating economic policies. Discusses the Australian Public Sector, the market system, market capitalism, the Great Debate and other recent Australian experiences.

results.title: Economic growth. 2. Policy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck of Business Studies at Melbourne College of Advanced Education, dicusses economic growth in Australia, causes of Australian growth and implication for Government policies.
